Goldeneye on N64. I was a student in a shared house. I'd get back from college, bang it on and as the 'dar da dumm dar da dumm' loading screen kicked in doors all over the house would open and within a minute the front room would be full of people desperate to shoot each other. At the time it was the best single player and the best multiplayer game of all time.

My first flight sim was the subLOGIC Flight Simulator for the Apple II.

It came with two manuals; the one devoted to "Flight Physics and Aircraft Control" wouldn't have been too out of place in a general flight training course.

This game was rather hard. A family friend who actually owned and flew a Cessna was, in fact, of the opinion that it was harder than real-life flying.

I spent a lot of hours on it anyway, especially in the WWI Ace battle game.

More accessible and fun (if rather less realistic) was F-15 Strike Eagle. (Good old Sid Meier again!) There were enough different keyboard controls that I played with a friend and we divided up tasks (just like in a real F-15E!).

This thread is full of nostalgia... NEEDS MOAR!
